ygData.subject: Farewell Atlantis
ygData.msgSnippet: I appreciate the research help you have given us over the years, said Lord Perseus. At the top of the Atlantis tower, the mayor s office had a bird s eye

"I appreciate the research help you have given us over the years,"
said Lord Perseus.

At the top of the Atlantis tower, the mayor's office had a bird's eye
view of the destroyed city.  It had taken three weeks to clear the
rubble and begin rebuilding; the Maximal base however, was a total
loss: only the lower level remained, which merely contained a
destroyed ractor system and the prison cells, which concievably be
modified to be used by the loca police.

"So you'll be leaving us?" asked the mayor, already knowing the answer.

"Yes.  I've come to the conclusion that our presence in the city
merely aggrivates conditions.  Without us, this island would become a
much lower priority for our enemies.  Though I hope we can continue
our research together; and I promise we will do anything we can to
help the city."

"So where will you be going?" the mayor asked after a moment of silence.

Perseus walked to the windows and sighed.

"We Maximals have been divided for too long.  With this Unicronian
threat, and our recent truce with Megatron. it would be apropriate for
us to put our diferences aside and work together.  So we'll first be
going to meet with Lord Elder."

"Well my friend, I wish you the best of success.  You are always welcome here."

"Thank you."
